info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 9:06PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN, LIKELY HEAVY, WITH RISING SNOW LEVELS LATE WEEK IN UPPER LYNN CANAL... An atmospheric river late this week into the weekend will bring warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and the potential for accumulating snow changing to heavy rain. Upper Lynn Canal will receive light to moderate snow Wednesday. A winter weather advisory is posted for Haines Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening for 3 to 6 inches of new snow. A short break is possible Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening before heavy precipitation moves in late Thursday night. At sea level, the precipitation may start as a mix of snow and rain before quickly changing to all rain, heavy at times. Snow will hang on longer for the Haines and Klondike highways and at higher elevations, with heavy snow possible near the Canadian border of the Klondike highway. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible from Thursday night through Sunday. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 9 inches are possible out the Haines highway and up to 12 inches at White Pass with lower amounts at lower elevations. Snow levels are forecast to rise to around 2,500 feet or higher which could lead to a melting mountain snowpack and introduce some nuisance flooding concerns. Rain at White Pass is not out of the question. Rain over deep snow on top of structures and rooftops could challenge load limits across Upper Lynn Canal. Please stay tuned to the forecast as it is refined through the week.
